page.title: 01Landscape Barbridge
page.content: The area is largely agricultural supporting intensive dairy farms on the Cheshire Plain.The population is widely scattered apart from two hamlets, Poole and Barbridge. The area is traversed by a network of winding country lanes apart from the A51 Chester to Nantwich trunk road. The Shropshire Union Canal follows closely the route of this road meeting the Llangollen Canal at the Hurleston Junction. The latter carries water from North Wales to Hurleston Water Treatment Works which supplies a large area of South Cheshire. Fields,copses, hedgerows and marl pits support a wide variety of animal,plant and pond life. Historical evidence shows Barbridge was situated on a section of the great Roman Way,Via Devana.Many tourists cruise along the canal each year.
